condition.narrative: Program Agreement, Schedule, Section I.A, Program Fiduciary, Environmental and Social Systems 1. Without limitation onthe provisions of Article V of the General Conditions, the Program Implementing Entity shall carry out the Program in accordancewith financial management, procurement and environmental and social management systems acceptable to the Bank, including those setout in the ESSA, the Procurement Guidance Manual, and the Program Action Plan, which are designed to ensure that: (a) the Loanproceeds are used for their intended purposes, with due attention to the principles of economy, efficiency, effectiveness,transparency, and accountability; and (b) the actual and potential adverse environmental and social impacts of theProgram are identified, avoided, minimized, or mitigated, as the case may be, all through an informed decision-making process.

Program Agreement, Schedule, Section I.B, Program Institutional Arrangements 1. Without limitation on thegenerality of Part A of this Section I, the Program Implementing Entity shall vest the overall responsibility for theimplementation of the Program in the Gujarat Council of School Education (GCSE), which shall carry out the Program activitiesthrough the State Implementation Society who is accountable to the GCSE. 2. The Program Implementing Entityshall establish within three (3) months of the Effective Date, and maintain, through the period of implementation, a ProgramManagement Unit (“PMU”) within the GSCE, which unit shall be provided with competent, experienced and qualified staff, insufficient numbers and under terms of reference acceptable to the Bank, and vested with powers, financial resources, functions andcompetences, acceptable to the Bank, to serve as the focal unit in the carrying out of the day-to-day implementation of theProgram, including compiling data on results and evidence on achievement of DLRs for submission to the Independent VerificationAgent and the Bank.

Program Agreement, Schedule, Section I.C, Program Action Plan 1. The Program Implementing Entity shall:(a)implement the Program Action Plan agreed with the Bank, in a manner and substance satisfactory to the Bank; and(b) refrain fromamending, revising, waiving, voiding, suspending or abrogating, any provision of the Program Action Plan, whether in whole or inpart, without the prior written concurrence of the Bank. 2. In the event of any inconsistency between t heprovision of the Program Action Plan and those of this Agreement and/or the Program Agreement, the provision of the latteragreement(s) shall govern.

Program Agreement, Schedule, Section I.D, Verification Protocols for the Program 1. The Program Implementing Entityshall:a. maintain, at all times during the implementation of the Program, independent verification agent under terms of referenceand with qualifications acceptable to the Bank (“Independent Verification Agent”), to verify the evidence supporting theachievement of one or more DLRs and certify the fulfillment of such DLRs as set forth in Schedule 3 to the Loan Agreement;andb. ensure that the Independent Verification Agent: (i) carries out verification processes in accordance with the terms ofreference agreed with the Bank; and (ii) furnish to the Bank the corresponding verification reports in form and substancesatisfactory to the Bank, prior to submission of any withdrawal application under Categories (1) to (7) of the table in SectionIV.A.2 of Schedule 2 to the Loan Agreement.

title.narrative: Students benefiting from direct interventions to enhance learning
Improved enrolment in residential schools for out of school girls and girls from vulnerable groups
Improved foundational learning outcomes at the lower primary level, gender disaggregated

baseline.value: Baseline assessment for foundational learning to be conducted/ established in year 2

target.value: An additional 2 percentage point improvement in percentage of students achieving minimum proficiency in learning outcomesassessment for Grade 4 language

title.narrative: District based planning systems enabled through capacity building support for decentralized education functionaries including SRGBVprevention protocols, complaint and referral mechanisms implemented

baseline.value: Limited capacity for evidence-based planning and appraisal amongst state and district level education functionaries and noinstitutional mechanism to identify and address safety/harassment issues experienced by adolescent girls.

target.value: (i) State level unit and all District Planning Teams retrained on process based AWPB creation; and (ii) At least 15 district AWPBsinclude a functional SRGBV prevention, reference and redressal mechanism

actual.value: Limited capacity for evidence-based planning and appraisal amongst state and district level education functionaries and noinstitutional mechanism to identify and address safety/harassment issues experienced by adolescent girls.

title.narrative: School level Annual Work Plan and Budgets (AWPBs) enhanced through community participation

baseline.value: Limited capacity of School Management Committees (SMCs) to participate in development of school plans

actual.value: Limited capacity of SMCs to participate in development of school plans

baseline.value: Limited use of Annual Work Plans and Budgets (AWPBs) based on data and process-based discussions with key stakeholders

target.value: An additional 5 district AWPBs approved, and show at least 75 percent utilization of funds sanctioned against Annual Work Plans andBudgets

actual.value: Limited use of AWPBs based on data and process-based discussions with key stakeholders

title.narrative: COVID 19 response strategies built in for systemic resilience

baseline.value: State has instituted a continuous learning plan as part of its COVID-19 response strategy

target.value: (i) An additional 15 percent of educators trained in digital competencies; and (ii) an additional 15 percent of decentralizededucation functionaries/ personnel trained on emergency response strategies for systemic resilience

actual.value: State has instituted a continuous learning plan as part of its COVID-19 response strategy

title.narrative: Access to Early Childhood Education (ECE) Programs for preschoolers

baseline.value: State is yet to roll out a model of Early Childhood Education (ECE) managed by the Department of Education

actual.value: Package for training of ECE teachers/facilitators notified

title.narrative: Quality remedial program based on classroom-based assessments

baseline.value: State is yet to roll out a state-wide remedial education program for concurrent identification and correction of learning gaps

target.value: An additional 20 percent of schools covered under ICT-supported Periodic Assessment Tests that provide student, subject and schoolwise reports on learning gaps and corresponding remedial education plans

actual.value: State is yet to roll out a state-wide remedial education program for concurrent identification and correction of learning gaps

title.narrative: Strengthened state level learning assessment systems

baseline.value: State planning on establishing an Assessment Cell to focus on management of student learning assessments; state has limitedexposure to international level student assessments

target.value: Timely completion of end-line Grade 4 learning assessment by the GAC

actual.value: Gujarat Assessment Center (GAC) for managing classroom, state and international level student assessments, notified

title.narrative: Improved technology enabled infrastructure in educational institutions

baseline.value: State plans to strengthen DIETs to provide teachers with access to opportunities for digitally enabled, remote professionaldevelopment

target.value: An additional 3 DIETs operating with the minimum basic package of digital infrastructure required to support online professionaldevelopment for teachers

actual.value: State plans to strengthen DIETs to provide teachers with access to opportunities for digitally enabled, remote professionaldevelopment

title.narrative: Improved learning environment in schools and teacher education institutes

baseline.value: State plans to upgrade the learning environment in 6,000 schools; and complete the construction and operationalization of 5District Institutes of Education and Training (DIETs)

target.value: (i)Strengthened child-friendly learning environment in an additional 1,500 schools and (ii) Construction of 5 new DIETs completedand facilities made operational with 75% staff in position in each DIET

actual.value: State plans to upgrade the learning environment in 6,000 schools; and complete the construction and operationalization of 5 DIETs

title.narrative: Improved school quality through performance evaluation and incentives

baseline.value: State proposes to institute a grading system to evaluate and incentivize school performance

target.value: 50 additional schools move to Lighthouse status based on agreed selection criteria and all 190 Lighthouse schools from Years 1 to 5maintain Lighthouse status

actual.value: State has instituted a grading system to evaluate and incentivize school performance

title.narrative: Performance-based selection of schools for learning environment and technology infrastructure improvement

baseline.value: State yet to initiate an enrolment and performance-based, inclusive model for selection of schools for infrastructure andfacilities upgradation

actual.value: State yet to initiate an enrolment and performance-based, inclusive model for selection of schools for infrastructure andfacilities upgradation

title.narrative: Performance grants instituted for schools to incentivize improved outcomes

baseline.value: State yet to institute a mechanism for providing performance based grants to schools

target.value: 500 additional schools meet minimum performance criteria as per agreed standards

actual.value: Performance based grants mechanism with school selection process prepared and cleared with the World Bank

title.narrative: Strengthened teacher development for classroom performance

baseline.value: State yet to institute teacher training needs assessments for guiding the customized delivery of teacher professional development

target.value: Third teacher training needs assessment completed, and grade-level learning hard spots identified through needs assessment reducedby an additional 5 percent

actual.value: State to complete analysis of teacher training needs assessment for guiding the customized delivery of teacher professionaldevelopment

title.narrative: Teacher training and management systems strengthened for performance tracking

baseline.value: Teachers have limited access to opportunities for need based professional development

actual.value: State level agency designated for carrying out periodic teacher training needs assessments

title.narrative: Students benefiting from direct interventions to enhance learning - Female
